group_1.textCenter: The time has come, brothers and sisters!

group_1.narration: "This town shall rise up and follow@in Lady Heruka's footsteps!"
"That's right! Cast out those evil Mongols!"

group_1.textLeft: [chara:833900:effect_7000_attack01]Y-you little!

group_1.textRight: [chara:833900:effect_7002_damage01][se:3001_chara_damage][bgEffect:shakeLarge]Aaah…!
Salvation for all mankind, heavenly paradise…

group_1.textLeft: Don't come any closer!
Wh-what's with these people… They keep on@coming no matter how many you defeat!

group_1.textRight: I don't want to do this anymore!@This battle is madness!
[flashEffect:flashRed2][se:3001_chara_damage][chara:790300:effect_shake][bgEffect:shakeLarge]GAH!

group_1.textLeft: All those who oppose Lady Heruka are enemies!
[flashEffect:flashRed2][se:3001_chara_damage][live2dName:live2d_0:effect_shake][bgEffect:shakeLarge]...Hyah!

group_1.textCenter: I never expected that we'd face@our own comrades in battle…

group_1.textRight: ...Such is the state of affairs.

group_1.textLeft: I see… It seems my army has been caught@in a quagmire…
I wish we had done away with the nunnery@when we had the chance…

group_1.textRight: …To think a simple retreat would put you@into this position.

group_1.textLeft: There's nothing that can be done about it now.
…So what brought you here?@I get the feeling it's no mere status report.

group_1.textRight: I have been informed that you will not@be punished...
However…you are to show the might@of our army once more.
Take the village where Heruka's cult has@fortified themselves…and burn it to ash.

group_1.textLeft: …We'll have many desertions.

group_1.textRight: These are orders from on high,@so if you disobey them…

group_1.textLeft: I won't be the only one executed.@It will be all of you as well.
…I'm sorry you've been assigned to me.

group_1.textRight: No, it's alright…

group_1.textLeft: This was an inevitable course anyway.
If you are to do a job, you must do it fully.
…I have not forgotten my hatred from the loss@of my comrades.

group_1.textRight: All clear…
There was only a Familiar in that Labyrinth.

group_1.textLeft: They've been cropping up more frequently...@Perhaps they're building up to something.
Are you feeling worn-out, Heruka?

group_1.textRight: Witches used to be Magical Girls, weren't they?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, yeah… That's right…
But…in order to purify our Soul Gems…

group_1.textRight: Oh, yes, I understand... I didn't mean to sound@like I was rejecting the notion.
I must serve as this land's final Magical Girl,@at least…
…That's enough for today.
I'm sorry for making you help me even though@you only just returned.

group_1.textLeft: It's fine, don't worry about it…
Don't be too hard on yourself, alright?

group_1.textRight: Yes, I know.

group_1.textLeft: (...No you don't.)

group_1.textRight: Phew…@We can finally relax.

group_1.textLeft: After traveling around to spread the gospel,@we had a Witch hunt on top of that...
…Is it alright for us to meddle with history@like this?

group_1.textRight: There should be no issue at this level.@And besides, according to the book…

group_1.narration: "From this nunnery, the Rakshasi is born...@She will end the war between Mongolia and Tibet."
"While I don't quite know what a Rakshasi is,@I'm pretty sure it refers to Heruka."
"So we need to ensure that she becomes a Rakshasi@after the war with Mongolia is resolved."

group_1.textRight: Fulfilling that, Big Sister's concept should be@gathered without issue.

group_1.textLeft: I wonder what being a Rakshasi really entails…

group_1.textRight: There's also something to the fact that she@has to "end" by becoming a Rakshasi.

group_1.textLeft: That's the only part I don't understand…@Everything else seems to follow the record.

group_1.textRight: Indeed, in the end, the nunnery has become@just as Big Sister described.
Which makes it all the more concerning@that this aspect is still unclear.

group_1.textLeft: (Heruka seemed to know something@about that…)
(But when I tried asking her about it after@the battle, she deflected…)
Is it taboo…? Perhaps people don't talk about it@for religious reasons…

group_1.textRight: Hmm… Now that you mention it, we haven't@looked into the religion all that much.

group_1.textLeft: It's certainly a lot to look into…
But given we don't have any other leads,@why don't we investigate?

group_1.textRight: A sound proposal.
I'm afraid I don't have a full grasp on@the situation at hand either.

group_1.textLeft: You don't?

group_1.textRight: If there are particular teachings that are taught@only within a particular monastic sect,
then such knowledge would naturally be@beyond me.

group_1.textLeft: You really think that's what's going on here?@Isn't this a plain old temple like any other?
The former Lama is said to have kept a far@reaching collection, so maybe that will help.

group_1.textRight: Didn't Heruka mention something about that?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah… She mentioned that there were writings@on the Mongolian climate and culture.

group_1.textRight: So they were trying to learn more about them.

group_1.textLeft: …But in running away, it was all for naught.

group_1.textRight: Indeed…

group_1.textLeft: Let's just read it for now. Wait, hold up...@We can read in this language, right?

group_1.textRight: But of course.

group_1.textLeft: (...Hopefully we can glean something from this.)
